div.p: A BODY of DIVINITY: WITH FUNDAMENTALL SCRIPTURES, Drawn into A TABLE: BY ROBERT BETTS, Preacher of the Goſpel at Swanſcombe in KENT.
LONDON, Printed by Richard Cotes, for Io. Bellamie, and are to bee ſold at his ſhop, at the three Golden Lions in Cornhill, neare the Royall Exchange. 1646.

div.head: A BODY of DIVINITY WITH FUNDAMENTALL SCRIPTURES, Drawn into A TABLE.
div.p:
The Sacred Scriptures are the Word of God, 2 Tim. 3. 16. Given by inſpiration from God, and reveale that Joh. 17. 3. This is life eternall, that they may know thee the onely true God and Jeſus Chriſt. eternall life conſiſts in the ſaving knowledge
1. Of God in his
1. Beeing, That hee is Joh. 4. 24. God is a ſpirit, that is, he hath no body as man hath, Luk. 24. 39. a Spirit, having his 1 Tim. 1. 17. Eternall, that is, without beginning or ending. eternall Exod. 3. 14. I am that I am, that is, I have my beeing of my ſelf and of no other. beeing of himſelf.
2. Properties, That God is Pſal. 147▪ 5. His underſtanding is infinite, that is, without limits. Jer. 23. 24. I fill heaven and earth, that is, I am in every place. infinite in wiſdom, in Iſa. 40. 26. Strong in power, that is, able to doe all things: power, in Pſal. 119. 68: Thou art good and doeſt good. goodneſſe, in Exod. 34. 6. The Lord God, mercifull and gracious, long ſuffering, &c. mercy, in Deut. 32. 4. A God of truth, without iniquity, juſt and right is he, Pſal. 11. 7. juſtice, in Exod. 15. 11. Who is like thee glorious in holineſſe? Pſal. 145. 17. Holy in all his works. holineſſe, in 1 Tim: 6. 15. Who is the bleſſed and onely potentate, the King of Kings, &c. bleſſedneſſe, in Pſal. 8. 1. How excellent is thy Name! Deut. 28. 38. This glorious and fearefull name, &c. glory, and in Job 11. 7. Canſt thou by ſearching finde out God? that is, the perfections of God cannot be found out. all perfections.
3. Perſons, 1 Joh. 5. 7. There are three that beare record in heaven, the Father, the Word, that is, the Son, and the Holy Ghoſt, and theſe three are one, that is, one God.
The Father
The Son
The Holy Ghoſt
Deut. 6. 4. The Lord our God is one Lord. One God.
4. Works,
The Decree of
Election, Epheſ. 1. 4, 5, 6. As he, that is, God, hath choſen or elected us in him, that is, Chriſt, &c. Rom. 9. 23. Veſſels of mercy which he hath prepared unto Glory. which is the fore-ordaining ſome Angels and men to eternall ſalvation through Jeſus Chriſt.
Preterition, Jude 4. Ordained to this condemnation. 1 Theſſ. 5. 9. God hath not appointed us unto wrath, that is, as he hath done others, but to obtain ſalvation by our Lord Jeſus Chriſt. or reprobation, which is the leaving of the reſt in their ſins to their juſt condemnation, to the praiſe of his juſtice.
The execution of his Decree, in
Creation, Gen. 1. Chap. Heb. 11. 3. The worlds were framed by the Word of God, that is, all creatures. which is God his making of the whole world out of nothing, by his word, in ſix dayes.
Providence, Act. 17. 28. In him, that is, in God, we live, and move, and have our beeing. which is God his Nehem. 9. 6. Thou preſerveſt them all, that is, all creatures. preſerving, upholding, Prov. 16. 4. The Lord hath made all things for himſelf, that is, for his own glory. diſpoſing of all the creatures in all their wayes.
2 Of Jeſus Chriſt in
1. His Mat. 1. 23. Immanuel, God with us. Joh 1. 14. The Word was made fleſh, that is, the Son of God was made man. 1 Tim. 3 16. God manifeſt in the fleſh, that is, the Son of God. Perſon, that he is Immanuel, God and man in one perſon.
2. His Office of Mediator, to 1 Tim. 2. 5. One Mediator between God and men, the Man Chriſt Jeſus. 2 Cor. 5. 19. God was in Chriſt reconciling the world to himſelf, &c. reconcile man to God, That he is my
Prophet, Act. 3. 22. A Prophet ſhall the Lord raiſe unto you, even Chriſt. Joh. 1. 18 Jeſus Chriſt declares God. Joh. 15. 15. I have made known unto you ſaith Chriſt to his Diſciples. Joh. 16. 15. The Spirit ſhall ſhew unto you. Joh 14. 26. He ſhall teach you. to teach mee the whole will of God by his Word and Spirit.
Prieſt, Heb. 7. 26. Such an High Prieſt became us who is holy, harmleſſe.
To Heb. 10. 14. By one offering he hath perfected for ever them that are ſanctified, that is, made perfect expiation of ſin. Heb 9. 14. Who offered himſelf without ſpot to God. Col. 1. 20. Having made peace through the blood of his Croſſe. offer up himſelf a Sacrifice unto God for ſin, by death on the Croſſe.
To Heb. 9. 24. Chriſt is entred into heaven it ſelf, now to appear in the preſence of God for us. Heb. 7. 25 He ever liveth to make interceſſion, &c. enter into heaven to appeare in the preſence of God, making interceſſion for all that come unto God by him.
King, Rev. 17. 14. He is Lord of Lords and King of Kings, that is, Jeſus Chriſt.
To Rev. 2. 27. He ſhall rule the nations with a rod of iron, Pſal. 2. 9. Of Chriſt. Pſal. 110. 2. Rule thou in the midſt of enemies. Reign over the world in his dominion of power, bridling and ſubduing his enemies.
To Rev. 15. 3. Thou King of Saints, i. e. the Lord Jeſus is King of Saints. Reign over his Saints, 1 Cor. 1. 2. Called to be Saints. Epheſ. 4. 12. For the gathering together of Saints. gathering them out of the world, Pſal. 110. 3. Thy people freely willing in the day of thy power. Pſal. 45. 5. Thine arrows ſharp in the hearts of the Kings enemies, that is, thy words are piercing, convincing, converting. ruling in their hearts by his Word and Spirit, 1 Pet. 1. 5. Who are kept by the power of God to ſalvation, that is, the Saints. preſerving them to eternall life.
3. The two-fold eſtate wherein hee diſcharged the Office of Mediator viz.
1 Of Humiliation, in his
Birth; Jeſus Chriſt the eternall Son of God, took upon him the form of Phil. 2. 7. He made himſelf of no reputation, that is, he deveſted himſelf o • glory and Majeſty, Mat. 1. 23. A Virgin ſhall bring forth a Son, Luk. 1. 35. O • Mary. a ſervant, was born of a Virgin.
Life; Hee was a Iſa. 53. 3. He is a man of ſorrows, Heb. 4. 15. Touched with feeling of our infirmities, yet without ſin. Joh. 4. 6. Jeſus being wearyed. Luk. 4. 2. tempted of Satan he hungred. man of ſorrows, bearing our infirmities in his fleſh, as hunger, &c. yet without ſin.
Death; Hee was Phil. 2 8 He became obedient unto death, even the death of the croſſe. Gal. 3. 13 Chriſt being made a curſe for us, redeemed us from the curſe. 1 Pet. 2. 24. Who his own ſelf bare our ſins in his own body on the tree, that is, Jeſus bare the guilt and puniſhment of our ſins in his own body on the croſſe. obedient unto death, even the moſt accurſed death of the croſſe, for our ſins.
2 Of Exaltation, in foure degrees.
1 In Rom. 1. 4. Declared to be the Son of God with power, by the reſurrection from the dead. Act. 13. 30 God raiſed him from the dead. his glorious reſurrection from the dead.
2 In Act. 1. 11. This Jeſus who is taken up from you into heaven, Act. 2. 34. David is not aſcended into Heaven as Chriſt by his own power. his Aſcenſion into the higheſt Heavens.
3 In Act. 5. 31. Him hath God exalted with his right hand, to be a Prince and a Saviour. Heb. 8. 1. Chriſt our High Prieſt ſet on the right hand of the Throne of the Majeſty in the heavens. his ſitting at the right hand of his Father, in Majeſty and Glory.
4 In Matth. 25 31. The Son of man ſhall come in his glory, and all the holy Angels with him. Act. 17. 3. A day in the which he will judge the world in righteouſneſſe. 2 Theſſ. 1. 8. The Lord Jeſus ſhall be revealed from heaven, taking vengeance on them that know not G • d, and obey not the Goſpel of our Lord Jeſus Chriſt. his comming with power and great glory, to judge the world at the laſt day.
3 Of my own ſpirituall eſtate how it ſtands before God. Rev. 3. 17. Thou knowſt not that thou art wretched, &c. in what ſtate thou ſtandeſt before God.
1 What I am in a ſtate of nature, viz. in a wofull eſtate of ſin and miſery. Rom. 5. 17. & 21. As ſin hath reigned unto death.
1 I am in Adam altogether loſt. Wherein note three things,
1 That Gen. 1. 27. God created man in his own Image, that is, in knowledge, righteouſneſſe and holineſſe, Epheſ. 4. 24. Adam the firſt man was created of God in his own Image.
2 That Gen. 3. 21 Haſt thou eaten of the tree whereof I commanded thee that thou ſhouldeſt not eat.
Adam by tranſgreſſing the command of God in eating the forbidden Rom. 3 23. All have ſinned (in Adam) and fall ſhort of the glor • of God, that is, they doe not attain to that glorious Image of God which man ha • at firſt. fruit, was deprived of this glorious Image of God.
3 That by Rom 5. 12. & 19. By one man ſin entred into the world and death by ſin, ſo deat • paſſed upon all men. By Adam ſin, that is, the guilt of ſin, by imputation, and corruption by propagation, entred in • o the world, that is, came on all his poſterity and death the wages of that ſin, ſeized on all his poſterity. Epheſ. 2. 3. By nature th • children of wrath, as we are in Adam the firſt that ſinned, we are all liable to the wrat • of God.
Adam ſin entred into the world, & death by ſin, ſo I ſinned in Adam, and am by nature a childe of wrath.
2 I am in ſin wholly dead. Wherein two things.
1 By Rom. 5 12 In whom, i. e. in Adam, all have ſinned, ἐφ' ῷ. Gen. 6. 5. That every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was onely evill, i e. or the whole frame of th • ſoule, and all the purpoſes and intentions thereof. reaſon of Adams fall from God, my whole man is inclined to 1 Joh. 3. 4. Who ever committeth ſin tranſgreſſeth the Law, for ſin is a breach of the Law of God, what ever thought, word, action is againſt the Law of God, is ſin. Rom. 3. 9. They are al • under ſin, verſ. 12 There is none that doth good, no not one. all ſin againſt God.
2 I Epheſ. 4. 18 Alienated from the life of God. am without all ſpirituall life, Rom 3 19. All the world becomes guilty before God, that is, under Gods judgement. a guilty perſon before God, liable Ezech. 18. 4 The ſoule that ſinneth ſhall dye. Rom. 6. 23. The wages of ſin is death. to corporall and eternall death.
3 I am by the Law of God accurſed. Wherein 4 things,
1 The Rom. 10. 5. The man that doth thoſe things, that is, that are commanded in the Law, ſhall live by them. Gal. 3. 12 that is, that doth exactly perform them. Law of God requires exact obedience to every Command.
2 The Lev. 18. 5. If a man doe, he ſhall live in them, or by them: This is a legall promiſe, and differs from the promiſes of the Goſpel, wherein life is promiſed to him that beleeves in Jeſus Chriſt. Rom. 2. 13. The doers are juſtifyed. Law of God promiſes life to the doer, i. e. eternall life to him that obeyes it.
3 The Gal. 3. 20. Curſed is every one that continues not in all things that are written in the book of the Law to doe them. Deut. 27. 26. Curſed is he that eſtabliſheth not the words of this Law to doe them. Law threatens death, and the curſe to the tranſgreſſour.
4 Every Rom. 3. 19. What things the Law ſaith, it ſaith to them who are under the Law. Rom. 7. 1. The Law hath dominion over a man that is under it. 1 Tim. 1. 9. The Law is not made for a righteous man, that is, in its exacting and condemning power, but for the lawleſſe. man is under the exacting power of the Law, and under the curſe thereof, till hee bee Rom 6. 14. Yee are not under the Law, that is, as it is a covenant of works, but under Grace, that is, under the covenant of Grace. born again, and in that eſtate am I by nature as well as others.
2 What I am being brought into the eſtate of Grace, under the Covenant of Grace, Rom. 6. 14. & no more under
The Law
Sin
Wrath.
Gal. 5. 16. Yee are not under the Law. Rom. 5. 21. So might Grace reign through righteouſneſſe unto eternall life by Jeſus Chriſt.
1. In reſpect of Epheſ. 1. 7. In whom wee have redemption through his blood, that is, in Jeſus Chriſt. redemption, or the price of redemption payed. I am in and through Jeſus Chriſt redeemed. Wherein two things
1 That Epheſ. 2. 2. According to the Prince of the power of the Aire, that is, Satan the prince of darkneſſe, in the luſts of our fleſh. 2 Tim. 2. 26. Who are taken captive by him at his will, that is, by Satan. I was by nature in bondage to ſin and Satan, under their power at their commands.
2 I am 1 Pet. 1. 19. Yee were redeemed with the precious blood of Chriſt. 1 Tim. 2. 6. Who gave himſelf a ranſome for all, that is, a ſufficient price of redemption for all. Matth. 20. 28. The Son of man came to give his life a ranſome for many. redeemed from this wofull bondage by the precious blood of Jeſus Chriſt, given to bee a ranſome for mee.
2 In reſpect 1 Cor. 12 13. By one Spirit, that is, the Spirit of Chriſt, are all beleevers baptized into one body, ingraffed into Chriſt. of the application of this redemption by the holy Spirit.
I am Rom. 8. 30. Them he alſo called, that is, God called them effectually unto Chriſt. 1 Cor. 1. 9 By whom ye were called unto the fellowſhip of his Son Jeſus Chriſt. 2 Tim. 1 9. Who hath called us with an holy calling, not according to our works.
effectually called unto Jeſus Chriſt by the Spirit of Chriſt, through the Goſpel, that I may bee united to him and have fellowſhip with him.
In effectuall Calling, there is
1 The 1 Cor. 1. 24. Wee preach Chriſt crucifyed, the power of God, and the wiſdom of God. free offer of Chriſt.
2 The Joh 1. 12. As many as received him, to them gave hee the priviledge to bee the Sons of God. Joh. 6. 45 Every man that hath heard and learned of the Father, commeth unto me. receiving or laying hold on Chriſt by Faith.
In Faith note the
1 Definition, Faith is that whereby a poor Luk. 19. 10. The ſon of man, that is, Jeſus Chriſt, came to ſeek and to ſave that which was loſt. loſt ſinner, Col. 2. 6. As ye have received Chriſt Ieſus the Lord. receives Jeſus Chriſt, as Joh. 6 40. This is the Fathers will, that every one who ſeeth the Son and beleeves on him. Act. 4. 12. Neither is there ſalvation in any other, no Saviour beſides him. God the Father offers him in the Goſpel, Joh. 6. 36. He that commeth to me ſhall never hunger. comes to him for all good, and Epheſ. 1. 13. In whom ye alſo truſted, or reſted and relyed; after ye heard the word of truth. reſts wholly upon him.
2 The Ground of Faith is The free Heb. 11. 1. Faith is the evidence of things not ſeen, by ſenſe, yet ſeen in the promiſe. promiſe of God, made in 2 Cor. 1. 20. All the promiſes of God in Chriſt are yea and Amen, that is, moſt ſtable and ſure. Chriſt, Act. 10. 45. Who ever beleeves on him ſhall receive remiſſion of ſins. concerning the pardon of ſins, 1 Cor. 1. 30. Chriſt is made of God, Wiſdom, Righteouſneſſe, Sanctification, Redemption. righteouſneſſe, holineſſe, redemption, 1 Cor. 3 22 23. All are yours, that is, Miniſters, priviledges, the world, things preſent, things to come, and ye are Chriſts. all ſpirituall, temporall, eternall good.
3 In reſpect of the benefits which follow upon the ſoules union with Jeſus Chriſt.
1 I am by Faith in Jeſus Chriſt juſtified. Juſtification is a gracious act of Rom. 8. 33, 34. It is God that juſtifyeth, who is he that condemneth? Rom. 5. 1 It is Chriſt that dyed, yea rather that is riſen again, &c. God, whereby hee 2 Cor. 5. 19, 20. God was in Chriſt reconciling the world unto himſelf, not imputing their treſpaſſes unto them, that is, not laying them to their charge, but charging Chriſt with them. Ver. 21. For hee made him ſin for us, that wee might bee made the righteouſneſſe of God in him, that is, God laid upon Chriſt the ſins of the beleever. imputing the ſinnes of a beleever to Chriſt, and Chriſts righteouſneſſe unto him, he freely Iſa. 53. 6. And puts Ieſus Chriſts righteouſneſſe upon him. Phil. 3. 9. Not having mine own righteouſneſſe but the righteouſneſſe which is of God by faith, that I might be found in him. acquits him of the guilt and puniſhment of his ſinnes, and accounts him perfectly juſt in his ſight.
In this are 4 things
1 I have Pſal. 143. 2. In thy ſight ſhall no man living bee juſtifyed. Job 9. 2. How ſhould man be juſt before God? no righteouſneſſe of my own to appear before God with.
2 I ſtand Rom. 3. 22. The righteouſneſſe of God is by faith of Ieſus Chriſt unto all, and upon all that doe beleeve, that is, the righteouſneſſe whereby I ſtand perfectly righteous before God, is mine through Faith. righteous before God, through the righteouſneſſe of Jeſus Chriſt imputed to mee.
3 I Rom. 1. 17. In the Goſpel is the righteouſneſſe of God revealed from faith to fai •• the juſt ſhall live by faith, that is, Faith is the inſtrument by which I apprehen • the righteouſneſſe of Chriſt to be mine. Gal. 2. 20. The life I now live, I live •• faith in the Son of God, that is, by that faith which lookes up to Jeſus Chriſt th • Son of God. apprehend this righteouſneſſe of Jeſus Chriſt, and receive it to be mine own by Faith.
4 This 1 Joh. 5. 12. He that hath the Son of God Ieſus Chriſt, hath life. Epheſ. 2 8 By grace are ye ſaved through Faith, not of your ſelves, it is the gift of God. faith whereby I receive Chriſt into my heart, and cloſe with him as my Saviour, is wrought in mee by the Holy Ghoſt.
2 My Faith in Jeſus Chriſt is ſtrengthned,
1 Through the 1 Cor. 15. 10. By the grace of God I am that I am. Phil. 4. 13. I can doe a •• things through Chriſt who ſtrengthens me. grace of Chriſt inabling mee to Iſa. 55. 1, 2, 3. Ho, every one that thirſteth come to the waters, that is, the promiſes of the Goſpel, hearken diligently unt • me, and eat that which is good, &c. 3 Come unto mee, (ſaith Chriſt) heare, and you • ſoule ſhall live. apply the promiſes of the Covenant of Grace to Gal. 3. 14. & 22. Wee might receive the promiſe of the Spiri • through faith. receive all from Jeſus Chriſt in the free promiſe.
2 Through Chriſt inabling mee to make Rom 4. 11. Hee, that is, Abraham, received the ſigne of circumciſion, a ſeale of the righteouſneſſe of the faith which he had being yet uncircumciſed, &c. right uſe of the ſeales of the Covenant of Grace, Which are
1 Baptiſme, Heb. 6. 1. The Doctrine of Baptiſmes, i. e. the third principle following after Repentance and Faith. Tit. 3 5. By the waſhing of regeneration, that is, by the holy Ghoſt purging the ſoule from guilt, and defilement of ſin, in the new birth, and renewing it after the Image of God, all ſignified in Baptiſme. 1 Pet. 3. 20.
